Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Interface Highlighter

All Known Implementing Classes:
ErrorHighlighter, SpellingHighlighter, SyntaxChecker.Highlighter
public interface Highlighter
Highlighters are attached to an editor to add custom painting effects and marginalia.
Since:
3.0

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Set<MarginNote>
    getMarginNotes​(int lineIndex)
    Returns the marginalia for a line of text.
    JPopupMenu
    getPopupMenu​(MouseEvent e, HighlightedLine hl)
    Called before displaying a popup menu over the document area.
    String
    getToolTipText​(MouseEvent e)
    Called when the mouse hovers over the document area long enough for a tool tip to appear.
    void
    paint​(Graphics2D g, HighlightedLine hl)
    Called when the highlighter should paint the highlights for a given line.

  • Method Details

    • paint

      void paint​(Graphics2D g, HighlightedLine hl)
      Called when the highlighter should paint the highlights for a given line.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context to use for painting
      hl - information about the line to be highlighted

    • getToolTipText

      String getToolTipText​(MouseEvent e)
      Called when the mouse hovers over the document area long enough for a tool tip to appear. This provides the highlighter the opportunity to provide a custom tool tip for a highlighted segment. If multiple highlighters return a non-null tip, the first non-null tip will be displayed.
      Parameters:
      e - a mouse event indicating the location of the pointer over the document view
      Returns:
      the tool tip to display, or null

    • getPopupMenu

      JPopupMenu getPopupMenu​(MouseEvent e, HighlightedLine hl)
      Called before displaying a popup menu over the document area. If it returns a menu, that menu will be displayed instead of the default menu. If multiple highlighters are attached to the editor, the menu from the first highlighter to return one will be used.
      Parameters:
      e - the event that triggered the popup menu
      hl - information about the line where the popup menu was triggered
      Returns:
      a substitute menu, or null to use the default

    • getMarginNotes

      Set<MarginNote> getMarginNotes​(int lineIndex)
      Returns the marginalia for a line of text. May return null if a line has no margin notes.
      Parameters:
      lineIndex - the line for which notes are requested
      Returns:
      a set of notes for the line, or null
